inventory.commentary: 22jan07. update to wn2.1, added features. ahouston 22jan07 separated wn 3 from Sense 1 and created Sense 5. ahouston 22jan07 added Sense 6. ahouston

sense.name: act of moving or conveying something
sense.examples: The transport of goods between our cities has gone uninterrupted for centuries. His transport to the hospital via helicopter cost several thousand dollars. The membrane wall allows active transport of chemical substances into the cell nucleus. The treaty guarantees free and unhindered transport of crude oil from the region.

sense.name: vehicle, apparatus or instrument of conveyance
sense.commentary: TRANSPORT[+entity][+artifact][+conveyance][+vehicle] Something that serves as a means of transportation. Note: refers to an object that carries something from one place to another.
sense.examples: The Americans built a fleet of transports to move their marines and tanks across the ocean. The Concorde was a supersonic transport. The rebels attacked a column of transport trucks. Her usual transport to the campus was an old red bicycle.

sense.name: State of happiness
sense.commentary: TRANSPORT[+state][+emotional][+happiness][+extreme] An old-fashioned way of describing an overwhelming positive emotion.
sense.examples: Listening to the music put young Oliver into transports of joy. The magician's tricks sent the children into transports of delight.

sense.name: Tape player part
sense.commentary: TRANSPORT[+entity][+artifact][+drive][+tape][+magnetic] A mechanism that transports magnetic tape across the read/write heads of a tape playback/recorder.
sense.examples: John snapped the transport and disabled the whole tape player! The transport feeds the magnetic tape through the read/write head.

sense.name: a system, method or enterprise that provides conveyance
sense.commentary: TRANSPORT[+system][+technology][+transportation] Note: refers to the system at large, not a particular vehicle (Sense 2) or act of transport (Sense 1)
sense.examples: London has undergone renovations on its underground transport system. John worked in the transport industry after graduating with a Linguistics degree You'll need your own means of transport to get to this job. (some method, system)

sense.name: convicts in transit
sense.commentary: TRANSPORT[+entity][+person][+convict][+transiting] Note: refers to a person who is a prisoner, convict
sense.examples: These transports are being shipped to a maximum security prison outside Tulsa. A convict escaped while being a transport en route to a federal prison.
